page.title: 17Killerby Hall
page.content: {Killerby Hall}is situated to the south of Catterick Village and to the eastern side of the A1. Killerby Hall is an impressive country house facing south over parkland.The house was formerly a hunting lodge and therefore unoccupied for most of the year.The present building was completed in 1906 for the Moubray family,who owned collieries near Glasgow. The present owner,who lives in the hall with his family,is a "working farmer"and farms 600 acres around Killerby Hall.The family have a second farm of 300 acres across the River Swale,which is farmed by a brother. Together the brothers employ two full time skilled farm workers . Killerby Hall is chiefly an arable farm and the main crops are cereals.
